subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... I find only these three exceptions (first without /g/, then with /g/), all pretty marginal: _clanger_ mistake vs. _clango(u)r_ loud ringing sound
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> 4. the sound /N/+/g/
>
> I suggest #4 because 1.in practice most people will rarely distinguish
> "finger" and "sing" and 2. I know of no case where it is necessary to
> indicate that difference in writing and 3. the /Nk/ is more obvious
> and less error prone than /N/+/g/ and can be still be written as Ing+Key

I find only these three exceptions (first without /g/, then with /g/),
all pretty marginal:
_clanger_ 'mistake' vs. _clango(u)r_ 'loud ringing sound'
_hunger_ 'with larger testicles' vs. _hunger_ 'need for food_
_longer_ 'one who longs for something' vs. _longer_ 'more long'

I don't have a problem with omitting the /g/ here.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://ccil.org/~cowan
Assent may be registered by a signature, a handshake, or a click of a computer
mouse transmitted across the invisible ether of the Internet. Formality
is not a requisite; any sign, symbol or action, or even willful inaction,
as long as it is unequivocally referable to the promise, may create a contract.
--Specht v. Netscape
